column4: I've been using fat32 to share a partition between windows and ubuntu.   Has ntfs support gotten to the point where it would work better for this?
I see they support symlinks now,  and it supports larger files than fat32.

The only downside to using ntfs is that there is no chkdsk equivelent for linux, which means that if it's unmounted uncleanly you may have to use windows to repair it before it will mount again in linux.
You probably just want to use padsp / aoss instead.
